lines.text: Say, don't I know you from some place?

I'm afraid I don't believe in cigarettes, much less a machine for makin' them. It turns my stomach, sir, every time I have occasion to witness someone pokin' one of those vile concoctions into their face. I deal in cigars, sir. Nothing less.
I'm too old a horse to change my gait.
No woman who wants something is a lady. If she is, she doesn't get it.
The nice thing about being rich is having so much money.
We all felt pretty bad about your... trouble.
Yeah, I'll bet you cried hour after hour.
I've learned a great deal from you, Brant. If I weren't an honest man, I might be able to use it.
when he looks at me, I know I'm a woman.
You're not getting any presents from me.
Don't bet on it! You think all yuh have to do is snap your finger at me. All these years and not even a letter!
Then what good would a letter be?
Goodbye, Carpetbagger. If it means anything to you now, the worst mistake I made was you.
